name: Sarai (Sarah)
blurb: Sarah, matriarch of Israel, shares Abraham’s call and laughter: first incredulous at the promise, then joyful at Isaac’s birth (Gen 18; 21). Her story reveals both weakness (mistreated Hagar) and strength (partner in faith). Jewish tradition honors her as a mother in Israel; the New Testament presents her as a model of hope and as the free woman in Paul’s allegory.
